Legal_Issue: Entitlement to refugee protection under Canadian law
Evidence_Assessment: Birth certificate and passport proving Indian citizenship
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant must prove persecution or serious risk of harm
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's claim of Tibetan ancestry and fear of deportation to China
Legal_Rule: Citizenship in a safe country precludes refugee status
Procedural_Issue: Challenge to Immigration and Refugee Board’s decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution upon deportation to China
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to Indian citizenship
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to Board's decision
Key_Evidence_Considered: Indian birth certificate, passport, Tibetan ancestry
Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee protection system under IRPA
Applicant_Challenge: Dispute of Board's finding on citizenship and eligibility
Defendant_Response: Not applicable – government position aligned with Board's determination
Legal_Provision: Section of IRPA relating to refugee protection eligibility
Claimant_Status: Applicant with Indian citizenship and Tibetan heritage
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Not facing persecution as a citizen of India
Applicable_Process: Refugee status determination and judicial review
